meanings.definition: To remove a crown from someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The king was decrowning the queen in the play.
meanings.sent2: The knight decrowned the evil sorcerer in the epic battle.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick involved decrowning a volunteer from the audience.
meanings.sent4: The storm's strong winds seemed to decrown the trees of their leaves.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully decrowned the cake with a beautiful icing design.

meanings.definition: The act of dethroning or removing a ruler from power.
meanings.sent1: The decrowning of the tyrant brought peace to the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The rebels celebrated the decrowning of the oppressive leader.
meanings.sent3: The decrowning of the principal in the school play was met with cheers.
meanings.sent4: The decrowning of the champion shocked the sports world.
meanings.sent5: The decrowning of the queen bee led to chaos in the hive.

meanings.definition: The process of removing the top portion of something.
meanings.sent1: The decrowning of the mountain was necessary for the construction project.
meanings.sent2: The decrowning of the cake revealed the layers of delicious filling inside.
meanings.sent3: The decrowning of the cupcake left a mess of frosting on the plate.
meanings.sent4: The decrowning of the tree allowed more sunlight to reach the plants below.
meanings.sent5: The decrowning of the building exposed the intricate architecture underneath.
